snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown called on California voters to approve $6.9 billion in temporary new taxes, including a surcharge on big earners.
abstract: Gov Jerry Brown calls on California voters to approve $6.9 billion in temporary new taxes in the form of an income tax surcharge as part of yet another bad-news budget proposal, this one for 2012; warns that without those tax increases state would be forced to impose severe cuts in public schools that could reduce the school year by three weeks.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown called on California voters to approve $6.9 billion in temporary new taxes, including a surcharge on big earners.

headline.seo: Jerry Brown Asks California Voters to Pay $6.9 Billion in New Taxes
headline.main: Californians Are Asked for $6.9 Billion in New Taxes
headline.print_headline: Californians Asked for $6.9 Billion in New Taxes
